headline: Lucid CEO Sees Definite EV Demand Slowdown in US and Europe
summary: The discontinuation of federal tax credits in the US pulled EV purchases forward into the third quarter, Marc Winterhoff, Lucid’s interim chief executive officer, told Bloomberg Television on Wednesday.  The first batch of Gravity sport utility vehicles — Lucid’s second model, after the Air sedan — will arrive in Europe late this year, with deliveries starting in the first quarter of 2026.

content.title: Lucid CEO Sees Definite EV Demand Slowdown in US and Europe
content.summary: The discontinuation of federal tax credits in the US pulled EV purchases forward into the third quarter, Marc Winterhoff, Lucid’s interim chief executive officer, told Bloomberg Television on Wednesday.  The first batch of Gravity sport utility vehicles — Lucid’s second model, after the Air sedan — will arrive in Europe late this year, with deliveries starting in the first quarter of 2026.

headline: Elon Musk Sets Self-Driving Tesla Robotaxi Countdown To Three Weeks
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk doubled down Tuesday on his claim that "safety monitors" will be removed from Austin, Texas, "robotaxi" Model Y vehicles in the EV giant's ride-hailing fleet by the end of 2025.  TSLA edged up before Wednesday's stock market open.  In a videoconference at a xAI "hackathon" event on Tuesday afternoon, Musk said that unsupervised full self-driving is "pretty much solved at this point" and that "there will be Tesla robotaxis operating in Austin with no one in them, not even anyone in the passenger seat, in about three weeks."

content.title: Elon Musk Sets Self-Driving Tesla Robotaxi Countdown To Three Weeks
content.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk doubled down Tuesday on his claim that "safety monitors" will be removed from Austin, Texas, "robotaxi" Model Y vehicles in the EV giant's ride-hailing fleet by the end of 2025.  TSLA edged up before Wednesday's stock market open.  In a videoconference at a xAI "hackathon" event on Tuesday afternoon, Musk said that unsupervised full self-driving is "pretty much solved at this point" and that "there will be Tesla robotaxis operating in Austin with no one in them, not even anyone in the passenger seat, in about three weeks."

headline: This Week In Electric Vehicles - China's Rapid Rise as a Global Leader in Innovation
summary: China's electric vehicle (EV) market is rapidly advancing, solidifying its position as a global leader in EV production, sales, and innovation. The market has been bolstered by strong government policies, including strategic subsidies and significant investments in charging infrastructure, aiming for EVs to constitute nearly half of all passenger vehicle sales by early 2025. Major urban centers like Beijing, Shanghai, and Shenzhen have set ambitious electrification objectives, particularly in...

headline: Why Tesla Stock Is Deutsche Bank’s Top Car Pick for 2026
summary: Investors looking for a winning car stock might just have to go with  Tesla  according to Deutsche Bank analyst Edison Yu.  On Tuesday, Deutsche released its automotive outlook for the coming year and Tesla is one of Yu’s “top picks.”  Its car business might underperform in 2026, amid easing climate regulations in both the U.S. and Europe and “intensifying” competition in China—but the forecast is about more than that.

content.title: Why Tesla Stock Is Deutsche Bank’s Top Car Pick for 2026
content.summary: Investors looking for a winning car stock might just have to go with  Tesla  according to Deutsche Bank analyst Edison Yu. headline: Tesla Is All-In On Autonomous Driving And AI. Is Rivian Poised To Compete?
summary: Rivian holds its "Autonomy & AI Day" on Thursday at 12 p.m. ET.  While the format and the exact details of the event are still unknown, CEO RJ Scaringe said during the Q3 earnings call on Nov. 4 that Rivian will discuss and share information about its autonomous platform along with the "hardware and software roadmap" during the Dec. 11 event.  "Over the long term, we expect the industry to be fully electric, autonomous and software defined," Scaringe told analysts last month.

content.title: Tesla Is All-In On Autonomous Driving And AI. Is Rivian Poised To Compete?
content.summary: Rivian holds its "Autonomy & AI Day" on Thursday at 12 p.m. ET.  While the format and the exact details of the event are still unknown, CEO RJ Scaringe said during the Q3 earnings call on Nov. 4 that Rivian will discuss and share information about its autonomous platform along with the "hardware and software roadmap" during the Dec. 11 event.  "Over the long term, we expect the industry to be fully electric, autonomous and software defined," Scaringe told analysts last month.

headline: How Big Tech's AI build-out is 'mostly' a private credit story
summary: Big Tech companies are spending trillions to build out data centers, and the $40 trillion private credit market is supporting that build-out in a way public investors may not realize. As part of Yahoo Finance's exclusive coverage with executives at Apollo Global (APO), Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi sits down with Apollo Global Management's co-head of corporate credit, John Cortese, to discuss how artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure is a private credit story and to explain what investors get wrong about the space. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid. Note: Apollo Global Management is the parent company of Yahoo Finance.

content.title: How Big Tech's AI build-out is 'mostly' a private credit story
content.description:
Big Tech companies are spending trillions to build out data centers, and the $40 trillion private credit market is supporting that build-out in a way public investors may not realize.

As part of Yahoo Finance's exclusive coverage with executives at Apollo Global (APO), Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi sits down with Apollo Global Management's co-head of corporate credit, John Cortese, to discuss how artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure is a private credit story and to explain what investors get wrong about the space.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

Note: Apollo Global Management is the parent company of Yahoo Finance.

headline: Elon Musk says DOGE was only 'somewhat successful' and he wouldn't do it again
summary: Mega billionaire Elon Musk, in a friendly interview with his aide and conservative influencer Katie Miller, said his efforts leading the Department of Government Efficiency were only “somewhat successful” and he would not do it over again.  The Tesla and SpaceX CEO, who also owns the social media platform X, still broadly defended President Donald Trump's controversial pop-up agency that Musk left in the spring before it shuttered officially last month.

content.title: Elon Musk says DOGE was only 'somewhat successful' and he wouldn't do it again
content.summary: Mega billionaire Elon Musk, in a friendly interview with his aide and conservative influencer Katie Miller, said his efforts leading the Department of Government Efficiency were only “somewhat successful” and he would not do it over again.  The Tesla and SpaceX CEO, who also owns the social media platform X, still broadly defended President Donald Trump's controversial pop-up agency that Musk left in the spring before it shuttered officially last month.

headline: Talk of an AI bubble is just 'ridiculous,' this strategist says
summary: Investors are still going back and forth over whether there is an AI bubble surrounding markets (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) or whether it is going to pop soon. One Wall Street analyst finds the chatter over the existence of an AI bubble "ridiculous." Humilis Investment Strategies CEO and Chief Investment Officer Brian Belski sits down with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to explain his thoughts on the AI trade, dynamic changes since the Dot-Com Bubble of the 1990s, and his view on the Magnificent Seven tech stocks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Talk of an AI bubble is just 'ridiculous,' this strategist says

Humilis Investment Strategies CEO and Chief Investment Officer Brian Belski sits down with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to explain his thoughts on the AI trade, dynamic changes since the Dot-Com Bubble of the 1990s, and his view on the Magnificent Seven tech stocks.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Elon Musk Claims Tesla's Robot Will 'Just Follow You Around' To Stop Crimes — A Prison-Free Future Where You Can 'Do Anything' Except Break The Law
summary: Forget Robocop. Elon Musk's vision for the future of law enforcement skips the guns and courtroom drama and jumps straight into the uncanny valley of artificial intelligence. His pitch? Give everyone a Tesla Optimus robot—not to help fold laundry, but to quietly shadow you and make sure you don't commit crimes. That's it. No prison bars, just persistent, AI-powered accountability. "If you say, like, you now get a free Optimus and it's just gonna follow you around and stop you from doing crime, b
